column4: my roommate closed my computer while I was updating to 11.04, which crashed the comp (my comp crashes when closed, an issue i haven't gotten time to fix yet) and now I can't boot into my ubuntu partition
mount the partition, back up your data, download system iso, install.
mount the partition in windows? when i install from the cd, will it be obvious what partitions to install to?
the objective is to save whatever data you need before reinstallation, thats all
I was wondering about the reinstallation process, since the computer has already been partitioned by the previous time I installed, I can just choose to install into the partitions that were made?
if there is no valuable data, then you can skip this step
i think i will skip it, nothing important was on there, all of it is luckily on my windows partition
i assume you want to dual boot, yes?
alright, i think you can take off then
you sure about dual booting though?
the iso already installed from the website
just to make sure, I have a 64bit computer, i want the 64 bit of ubuntu right? is there any reason i would want to use the 32bit version?
64bit. be aware that you'll need install ai32-libs to obtain support to run 32bit apps
